War in Ukraine: Europe finds itself sidelined and humiliated by the Trump administration
subhead: Steve Witkoff, the US president's special envoy, and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law, chose to meet the Ukrainian negotiators in Miami after canceling their Brussels stopover on their return from Moscow.

Macron receives rockstar greeting from students in China while wife Brigitte visits pandas
subhead: Hundreds of Chinese students and local residents lined up at a university in the city of Chengdu to welcome the French president. Meanwhile, First Lady Brigitte Macron paid a visit to Chengdu's giant panda research base.

title: European Commission fines X €120 million for transparency violations
subhead: Brussels ruled that Elon Musk's social media platform violated three provisions of the European Union's Digital Services Act related to transparency and accountability. It is continuing its investigation into the dissemination of illegal content and misinformation.

title: In Washington, DRC and Rwanda sign fragile peace agreement under auspices of Trump
subhead: Under US pressure, Kigali and Kinshasa signed what Donald Trump called a 'historic' a peace deal on December 4. But behind the diplomatic staging, distrust between Paul Kagame and Félix Tshisekedi remains palpable and fighting continues in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: After Le Scouarnec sexual abuse trial, court faces challenge of compensating victims
subhead: Following the sentencing of French surgeon Joël Le Scouarnec to 20 years in prison for rape and sexual assault of 298 victims, most of them minors, a Brittany criminal court is now working on compensations claims in hearings that blend emotion and legal technicality.

Iran's independent cinema in full revolt: 'With Woman, Life, Freedom, a major barrier was broken'
subhead: Galvanized by the movement that emerged after the death of Mahsa Amini in September 2022, more and more filmmakers are dating to shoot outside any official framework. In a country where film production is a state matter, their films, made and distributed clandestinely, show Iranian society as it really is.

title: PFAS: France's tap water is widely polluted with TFA, the most common 'forever chemical'
subhead: A French state health agency analyzed over 600 samples of drinking water. 92% of them contained traces of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA), the smallest PFAS molecule, which is suspected to be toxic.

title: French society's anti-Mafia awakening
subhead: Since March in Corsica and November in Marseille, the French have taken to the streets to oppose Mafia groups threatening democracy, whose power endures thanks to their social control over the population.
